intro: Castanospora alphandii, commonly known as the Alphand's castanospora, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It typically grows in woodland areas and is adapted to well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
